post_text:
Due to public health restrictions in place, the July 21, 2020 Springfield Board of Education Meeting has been changed to a virtual meeting that can be viewed through YouTube at
https://www.youtube.com/springfieldspartans

The meeting will start at 6:00 p.m.

Citizen's comments will be accepted until 5 p.m. on the day of the meeting (must include name and address) via comments@springfieldspartans.org
Zoom access can be provided to citizens who would like to publicly speak in the meeting. Email your request to comments@springfieldspartans.org by 5 p.m. on the day of the meeting. Comments will be limited to 5 minutes.

Arrive Alive runs from 6p Friday July 3 through 6a Sunday July 5.

For LYFT rides use the code SCPO7420 for a one-time discount of $20. There is a limit of 300 codes.

For a FREE ride home in Summit County, call City Yellow Cab at 330.253.3141 and mention Arrive Alive

post_text: If you have a child in kindergarten through 12th grade who was receiving free or reduced-price meals while in school, your child is eligible for the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program to receive Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits as a result of the school closure. Click here for more info: https://jfs.ohio.gov/ofam/p-ebt.stm

post_text:
BEYOND THE CLASSROOM

VIRTUAL SUMMER CAMP 2020

Explore mathematics through engaging activities in an untraditional environment during this weeklong math summer program for middle and high school students. Discover the richness and beauty of mathematics and have fun! Build skills and confidence and express your creativity. The program especially encourages female and gender nonconforming students to apply.

Dates:
High school - July 6 to 10
Middle school - July 20 to 24
Cost: Free!

Learn more or apply: math.osu.edu/btc-gem

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Ellen is a committed student. Ellen is an excellent choice for a POP student. She is able to stay on task and is prompt with her work. Teachers enjoy having her in class because she is pleasant to be around. Ellen is always cheerful and ready to work. She always does her best to conquer the task at hand. She is so sweet to everyone in French class and she's a hard worker. Ellen has shown much improvement this year in her focus for school. She is attentive and on task, and her grades have been reflecting this. Good job Ellen!
Ellen helps make class fun with her involvement and creative suggestions to our class stories.

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Samantha is kind to everyone around her. Sammi thrives on being busy! In addition to being an excellent student, she is a Springfield High School cheerleader and maintains an after school job at Panera. Her fellow students find her pleasant, helpful, and considerate. She always has a smile on her face. She is always willing to participate—asks as well as answers questions. Very pleasant. Enjoy having her in class. Teachers love her willingness to learn. Sammi is a very hard worker. She is always pleasant and respectful to her peers and teachers. At home, her family relies on her dependability to help with her younger siblings. People love being around Sammi because she shines wherever she may be.

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Do you need something fixed or made? Anytime someone has had issues or need a problem solved: putting things back together, making a sign, or finding ways to make a fancy rotating bookshelf, the students suggest we take our projects to Pete Geiss! He is always willing to help out. He often uses these opportunities to put his classes to work to find a solution. He knows that this hands-on experience is a great way to model helping others and teaching new skills. Obviously the students have confidence in his skills too or they wouldn't suggest his help. Many students say how much they learn in Pete Geiss’ class. He holds kids to a high standard. Pete Geiss is a wonderful role model for our students for his generous heart, strong work ethic and does things for others with a gracious attitude!

post_text:
Tonight at (8:20 pm) schools across the state of Ohio and America will be turning on their stadium lights for 20 minutes and 20 seconds to show their support for the Class of 2020. To show support from home, parents and families are asked to turn on their front porch lights at 8:20 pm for 20 minutes and 20 seconds as well.

Let's honor our seniors during this unprecedented time by shedding some 'light' and giving them hope and encouragement that better days are to come!

Thank you for supporting the Class of 2020!

#InThisTogetherSpartans
Thank you to everyone for putting this together for the Springfield Staff!
shared_text:
Miranda Terry
April 14 at 1:31 AM ·

We ❤️ Our Spartan Teachers!

Today marks 1 month since schools closed & students said goodbye to teachers & staff in the Springfield School District here in Akron, Ohio (Lakemore, Springfield, Uniontown & Akron to be specific) due to the Covid-19 Virus. Since then, school has been done remotely. Our kiddos and families miss their teachers so much! We love all they have done for us over the past month. From Zoom meetings, phone calls, specials drive by waving... And everything in between. No matter the distance between all of us Spartans, we are in this Together and Are Spartan Strong!!

❤️ A huge Thank You to everyone that sent pictures & helped spread the word the last 3 days so we could reach as many Spartan Families as possible ❤️ We had over 150 Spartans get involved!!!!! ⭐

Please share and a link is in the comments as well

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Fernando Aguirre has matured a lot over the last year. While improving his grades and being active in sports, he also manages to put in a lot of work hours outside of school. He is fun to talk to, polite, and respectful. He works hard to keep up with the workload for his sophomore year. As a first-year soccer player, he has an upbeat personality and is a good addition to the soccer team. He is respectful; the type of kid who thanked his coach for coming out and watching him play basketball. He also set up our sports fundraiser at his workplace. Other students look to him for leadership or for a friendly face.

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Alexus is a second-year nominee for the POP wall! She demonstrates great responsibility for her work and always has a great attitude. She asks clarifying questions until she understands. Alexus is an awesome office aide. Her work product is EXCELLENT. Several teachers have witnessed her helping other students who struggle. She completes work in a timely manner, even if she has to complete work at home. After a class discussion about a lab, she emailed her teacher a recipe and plan that would help enhance the lesson in class. She is an advanced math student. If an assignment on the computer needs finishing, she uses her own time before school to find a teacher who will let her use a computer. She always has a big smile and a great attitude. Many teachers say that she makes their day brighter!

post_text:
Springfield Families,

It is with a heavy heart that I inform you that 8th grade student Ryan Clemons has passed away from a brain tumor. We are all deeply saddened by this news. Pray for comfort for his family and for all his friends grieving this great loss. He was such an intelligent and sweet young man.

For those students who need to grieve and share, we have set up a zoom meeting in order to meet during this time of physical distancing. The meeting will begin at 5:30pm. Counselors, Mrs. Rummer and Mrs. Heade will be leading the meeting. Here is the link:

Time: Mar 25, 2020 05:30 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/3903280592

Meeting ID: 390 328 0592

With a hurting heart,

Mr. Shaun M. Morgan

post_text: Springfield Local School District is continuing to monitor the COVID-19 (coronavirus) situation. In response to directives given to school districts by Governor DeWine, we are preparing materials so that students can continue to learn in case of school closing. While some students may have already received these items, others will get them in the next few days. Students are only expected to complete these assignments in case of closures. At this time, schools remain open. If this changes, we will communicate this information as soon as possible. We will continue to update you regarding this situation and make decisions for the safety and well-being of our students, staff and community.

post_text: Creative thinking can help your child do well in all subjects. Suggest taking photographs that fit a particular theme like the color green, wildlife, or architecture. Your teen might use photography software to make a collage of the pictures.
text: Creative thinking can help your child do well in all subjects. Suggest taking photographs that fit a particular theme like the color green, wildlife, or architecture. Your teen might use photography software to make a collage of the pictures.

post_text: Kids often lie to avoid getting in trouble. Promote honesty by letting your child know you appreciate being told the truth, even when it’s about something negative. For instance, you might say, I’m upset that you broke my favorite mug, but I’m glad you told me.

post_text: Up to 1/3 of teens report being cyberbullied—and this type of bullying is tough for adults to detect. Ask your child questions about online activities. Examples: “What are your friends up to online these days?” and “Do you know anyone who has been cyberbullied?”
text: Up to 1/3 of teens report being cyberbullied—and this type of bullying is tough for adults to detect. Ask your child questions about online activities. Examples: “What are your friends up to online these days?” and “Do you know anyone who has been cyberbullied?”

post_text: Legos make it easy to demonstrate fractions. Use a brick with 8 studs (bumps) as a whole. Ask your child what fraction of a whole other Legos are. Examples: A 1-stud brick = 1/8, a 4-stud brick = 1/2. What other fractions can your youngster find?

post_text: Be your teen’s partner in the decision-making process by listening and asking questions. Say your high schooler is deciding whether to accept a part-time job. You could say, “The company sounds interesting. Do you think the hours will work with your schedule?”

post_text: Spark your teen’s interest in a science career by visiting a museum, planetarium, zoo, or botanical garden. Some may have lectures or hands-on workshops where you can meet scientists. Your high schooler may also learn about volunteer opportunities or internships.

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Parker is the freshman representative for band. He’s done a great job in that role. As a freshman representative, he truly leads by example. He manages his time well, handles his responsibilities in and out of the classroom. He is always willing to go above and beyond what is expected of him. He is an amazing servant leader. He is respectful and kind and gives a good effort and achieves high marks. Parker is an amazing student that is exceptionally creative and always willing to go the extra mile to complete a task!

post_text: Board games that involve eliminating possibilities develop deductive reasoning. For your next family game night, try playing Clue, Mastermind, Stratego, Guess Who?, or Battleship. Tip: Look for gently used games at thrift shops and online yard sales.

post_text: Parenting requires a daily balancing act—especially when it comes to raising tweens and teens. A recent study found that only one in 20 young people are getting the recommended combined amount of sleep, exercise and screen time. http://ow.ly/PFMf50yqUN4

post_text:
POP
Prepared...Optimistic... Positive!

Heather is the sophomore representative for band. She has done an amazing job in the role. As the sophomore representative, she leads by example. She has organized fundraisers for her class as well as activities for class bonding. She goes above and beyond in showing servant leadership. Heather is a friendly face every day and a positive energy in the classroom. She is friendly with other students and staff. Academically, Heather is a hard worker and strives to do her best in the classroom. She is cheerful, helpful, participates often, kind, and works hard in class. Teachers state that they look forward to seeing Heather every day. Heather is one of my best students. Her smile is contagious . It is great coming to class to start the day and seeing someone ready and willing to learn. Great job Heather!

post_text: At approximately 3:30 p.m. today, a Springfield bus was involved in an accident at Killian Rd. and Bridgeport. The bus was transporting Springfield Local School students on their way home from school, but fortunately, no one was injured. The accident investigation is being conducted by The Ohio State Highway Patrol.
text: At approximately 3:30 p.m. today, a Springfield bus was involved in an accident at Killian Rd. and Bridgeport. The bus was transporting Springfield Local School students on their way home from school, but fortunately, no one was injured. The accident investigation is being conducted by The Ohio State Highway Patrol.

post_text:
Date: February 25, 2020
Time: 8:30 a.m. - 10:30 a.m.
Location: Springfield High School & Junior High
1880 Canton Road
Akron, OH 44312

Springfield Local Schools prides itself in providing a safe and secure environment for your children. With student safety in mind, Springfield Schools have coordinated with Springfield Police to conduct a search of Springfield High School and Junior High using multiple K9 units to detect illegal substances. In order to safely and quickly conduct this search, the building has been placed in lockdown. This is a planned activity and there is no reason for concern. Visitors will not be permitted… More
